name: The Mayflower Renaissance Washington, DC Hotel

reviews.text: As 4.5 stars goes this was only half of them. I arrived by taxi and no bell service was available as they were chatting inside. (A habit that continued throughout my stay. They did not once open the door for me.)I checked into a moderately sized room overlooking an alley way with a loud quirky heating system. Had this been a three star it would have been about right but no way is this 4.5 stars. The pillows were small and hard and the linens on the bed too short. I did not sleep well the entire stay. The beauty of the lobby is far outweighed by the merely average experience in the rooms.
reviews.title: Pretty Lobby but the rest is... meh...

reviews.text: This hotel was ideal for the conference I was attending. Very confortable, great staff, good food. A stroll away from the White House and also DC's nightlife. Quintessential American hospitality. Swimming pool not part of hotel but facilities good. I would definitely recommend it to friends and colleagues.
reviews.title: Classy central place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had not been in DC for many years - we found the location, the rooms and the staff at the Mayflower Renaissance fit all our needs. I had called the concierge ahead of our arrival and was very pleased with the service she gave. We walked to several restaurants recommended by the concierge (or found on Tripadvisor) and to a nearby church, we used the nearby metro stations, and appreciated the friendly but upscale atmosphere of the Renaissance. Our room was an upgrade, thanks to Marriott status and we were able to take advantage of the club level lounge, again based on Marriott status. There was an excellent breakfast buffet each morning in the club lounge and snacks were set out in the evening. Our room was spotless. The parking is expensive but we didn't want to drive in the city when it's much more convenient to use public transportation or walk. The staff was very friendly and helpful to us. I'm not a coffee drinker and the person at the front desk offered to personally get tea bags for me to have in our room when I mentioned that we only had coffee in the room.
reviews.title: Re-visiting DC

reviews.text: I spent a week here on a government rate, so I'm sure I did not have the best room in the house. It was pretty small though--no room for a side table on one side of the bed. The room was partly updated and partly old. The bath tub/shower was all newly tiled and had a great shower, but the wallpaper next to the tile was kind of old. Pillows in the bed were old and small. Good gym area. Super friendly staff. Bar had expensive drinks but a heavy pour. Nice touch of free apples and water bottles in the lobby (and gym). And a great location. I might return, but I would probably also look around for other options.
reviews.title: Old hotel updated but still working on it

reviews.text: Had I realized DC is practically within a couple miles (the sites) would have stayed somewhere that offers things like wifi and bar staff that can speak clear English. The bellhop and cleaning staff are great but as far as help from anyone else good luck. Gift shop girl who is obviously new is totally clueless to such simple things as you wrap jewelry and don't drop everything in a ball in a bag with a glass mug..seriously. It's like the staff is all hired by one person and they all know each other. For $400 a day you don't get WiFi, any food or free coffee and not even water in the warm refrigerator. There are many more hip places. This hotel needs to get a clue. Foreign visitors and conventions are keeping them alive. Edgars bar is good but slow as is everything in the city. We waited over 20 minutes for a drink. Prices are steep there too.
reviews.title: Clean, large but lacking basic things! Not worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was really looking forward to staying here so I think I should start with its plus points.
reviews.title: Trading on its name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. We walked to the Whitehouse from here and got the metro from Union station easy enough.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay with a great staff

reviews.text: The building. The building is impressive and the lobby area lives up to the past guests you read about in the tour books.
reviews.title: Grand Old Dame

reviews.text: The staff. Really helpful and waiting to help you. Check in was smooth and the girl was welcoming, giving me a map and was seemed genuinely lovely.
reviews.title: Great weekend

reviews.text: The not so good... Once you leave the lobby you feel as if the care and attention to the hotel stays there. The rooms were basic, and in need of some TLC. Yes it was big and clean but the finesse was just not there. The main down side for me was the bedding. They still used blankets which is a bit dated but the fitted sheet on the mattress did not fit it. To me this is a basic for any hotel and something I do not expect to see. The corners kept coming off and the sides rides up exposing the mattress. In the end I slept on the top sheet with the bathrobe over me. They also don't offer free wifi in the rooms. Something someone wandering throughout the lobby can get but not a paying guest.
reviews.title: Great location, super service
Wedding weekend
reviews.text: Nice room, comfortable bed and centrally located. Breakfast was expensive (but good) and the bar makes a good Martini. If the weather is nice you can walk to the White House, or just down to the subway stop at Farragut. The area is quiet on weekends but there are a number of interesting restaurants in the area. Didn't use it but heard good things about the gym. A food weekend getaway choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a tour which started in this hotel, so we went early for a few nights. Because of the government shutdown, we needed to find other venues to visit than the Smithsonian which we had seen several times before. There are many to choose from, some near this hotel. There iis a metro stop nearby also. The service was mostly excellent. The airlines broke the pull out handle on my suitcase and the maintenance staff was able to get it pulled out so we could roll it the rest of the trip. The executive lounge host is excellent, and lounge is very large and relaxing. Our first room had double beds. The room was large, very nice with a tub and on the executive floor, but I prefer a queen or king. When we returned to the hotel, we had a king on another floor, but the room was small, no tub, but very nice and comfortable. One night we had a delicious dinner in the hotel restaurant, the Edgar. On the tour we had breakfast there also. On our own, we had breakfast in the exec lounge.
reviews.title: Historic hotel, convenient and lovely

reviews.text: I came here for the Marine Corps Marathon race and this was a great hotel for the event. Very close to a Metro station stop and a fun neighborhood. The hotel is a beautiful historic property that's very see and be seen. All sorts of events going on every day. The staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms were nice, but need an update. Still very clean, and a comfortable bed, so not a problem. The hotel is a part of all events going on in the city. Many people were there for the race and they had tables of water bottles set up after the race, a nice touch I thought. Lots of good food in walking distance too.
reviews.title: Great hotel and perfect location!

reviews.text: I travel a lot for work, and I've stayed in all kinds of hotels. When I had to go to Washington at the last minute in early November, I found that most of the downtown hotels were booked up due to a big medical convention. I decided to take a chance on Priceline, and got the Mayflower at a great rate. When I arrived, I loved the block-long lobby, and all the care that has clearly gone into this hotel. Visiting the mezzanine over the lobby, I saw the history of the hotel in pictures and objects, and I just loved it. Clearly this hotel has been welcoming guests since 1925, and is still a very welcoming place to land. Even though I booked through Priceline, the hotel desk staff could not have been nicer, and I got a double room on the 9th floor. I had read the reviews here, so I was not sure what I would find - but here is the truth: I had all the hot water I wanted from the Kohler showerhead, I had great towels and Aveda toiletries (loved that!!!), I had 2 bathrobes, and extra blankets in the huge closet. I also had a big, HD flat screen TV, and a little fridge. I could print my boarding pass for free in the business center, get free water bottles at reception, and the checkout was impeccable - clearly the hotel puts on extra staff in the morning so that checkout goes fast for everyone. I really liked the hotel, and applaud the staff for being among the best I have ever encountered. A couple of things would make this 4.5 or 5 stars - like having a room safe to protect valuables, and replacing the pillows. The beds are comfortable, and very clean. But I have never seen little square pillows like these ones. There are a lot of them, but they are still too small. Having even one regular-sized pillow would have been great. But overall, loved the Mayflower, the gracious staff and the great facilities. I will be back!
reviews.title: Mayflower rocks!

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night for a wedding. Beautiful old restored hotel with a grand sense of history in a very central location . Metro is 1 block away. Very good service and good food. Price very fair . Rooms are nice but small as you see in all large city hotels. Would stay here again. Nice helpful concierge.
reviews.title: Beautiful historic hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Mayflower for the first time in about 10 years. Used to stay often and loved it, but my job changed and I no longer needed to go to Washington.
reviews.title: Still nice after a 10-year lapse, with some reservations

reviews.text: Wondered how it would compare to 10 years ago, and the verdict is mixed. The hotel is as beautiful as ever, and the housekeeping is impeccable, as is the service. As a Marriott Platinum member, I stayed in a large room on the 10th (top) floor. Ten years ago, this room would have been called a Junior Suite and would have had a sofa and perhaps two easy chairs. This time, it had only one not-too-comfortable easy chair with a mismatched ottoman. Also, the bed, though very comfortable, had a fairly thin covering and there was no extra blanket in the room. I would have preferred having the option of heavier covers so I could sleep with the window open.
reviews.title: Historical Hotel in a perfect location

reviews.text: Finally, the hot water was very weak and I could take only a short uncomfortable shower. I note another commenter noted the same thing around the same time I was there. I hope this is a short-term problem and not a characteristic of the upper floors.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings but not impressed
Fabulous hotel!
reviews.text: You cannot fail to be impressed when you walk into this very large and elegant lobby. But the best part was the very warm and welcoming reception staff. The room was a bit small (there were 4 of us though!) and the views weren't up to much, but it was very clean, comfortable and quiet and the décor of a high standard. We dined one night in the restaurant and ate the best food we had in the U.S. during our 15 night tour. Again the staff there were very friendly and welcoming.
This hotel is located within a few minutes walk of the White House and the Metro is just a few steps away.
reviews.title: Friendly staff in a beautiful old hotel in a good location

description: Known as the progressive Grand Dame of the nation's capital, The Mayflower Renaissance Washington, DC Hotel is a 4-diamond luxury hotel and a proud member of Historic Hotels of America. With a timeless aura highlighted by an abundance of modern conveniences, our historic hotel is perfectly located in the heart of downtown with iconic attractions like the White House and National Mall just minutes away. Our hotel features 650 guest accommodations and 74 handsomely-appointed suites each with signature Renaissance bedding and Aveda bath products. Ideal for leisure and business, our hotel offers exceptional meeting, banquet and event space, complete with an on-site floral boutique, multiple dining options and a Thomas Pink retail store.
